Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2009 07:36AM cliffhanger wrote: Hi, I just read your post.  You are in the right place as far as support is concerned.  I can understand that you don't want to worry anyone in the family, but please know that people do care about you.  This lump that you have could be a cyst and nothing more.  But I know you will feel better after you have the mammogram. I just had one myself because of thickening of left breast and pain in that area.  It turned out to be fibrous tissue.  Good thoughts and prayers coming your way for you and your mom.  God bless, June
Posts.Title: Went to Doctor today DaughterMom DaughterMom

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2008 05:37PM cliffhanger wrote: Thank you all for the responses.  I so appreciate you taking the time to reply.  I hope you all have a wonderful holiday, free of pain and worry and pray for all who have illness that they have to deal with every day.  God Bless
Posts.Title: breast pain and thickening cliffhanger rosied51

Posts.Content: cliffhanger wrote: I have been having some discomfort on the side of my left breast; feels like some sort of an irritation.  I thought it might be the material on my bra that was aggravating this area.  Went to my gyn doc yesterday and he said he felt some thickening in the area where my breast is tender.  He is sending me for a mammogram and a possible sonogram.  Can't get in til the end of the year.  I am scared.  I wanted to ask if anybody else had a similar burning pain in their breast.  Also, when you do self examination of your breast, I know you can feel a lump, but how do you know if you have thickening?  I'm confused as to how you detect that.  Any input on this would be very much appreciated.  I am very frightened and confused.  many thanks in advance for any info. Posts.Title: breast pain and thickening cliffhanger rosied51
